definitions.meaning: A written or printed work consisting of pages glued or sewn together along one side and bound in covers

examples.sentence: I read a book.
She borrowed a book from the library.
The comprehensive book provided detailed insights into quantum mechanics.

definitions.meaning: A type of Chinese cabbage

examples.sentence: I bought some bok choy.
Bok choy is a nutritious vegetable.
The recipe called for fresh bok choy from the farmers market.

definitions.meaning: The force that attracts a body toward the center of the earth, or toward any other physical body having mass

examples.sentence: Gravity pulls things down.
The apple fell because of gravity.
Einstein's theory of general relativity revolutionized our understanding of gravity.

definitions.meaning: A theoretical concept referring to the absence or negation of gravitational force

examples.sentence: The concept of agravity is theoretical.
Scientists explore agravity in their research.
The hypothesis of agravity challenges conventional understanding of physics.

definitions.meaning: A hypothetical force opposing gravity

examples.sentence: Antigravity is not real yet.
Scientists explore the concept of antigravity.
The theoretical framework for antigravity propulsion systems remains speculative.

definitions.meaning: An angular or directional aspect of gravitational force (theoretical term)

examples.sentence: The term angravity is rarely used.
Some theories discuss angravity in relation to rotational forces.
The concept of angravity explores the directional properties of gravitational fields.

definitions.meaning: To move at a speed faster than a walk, never having both or all the feet on the ground at the same time

examples.sentence: I run every day.
She runs five miles every morning.
The athlete runs with remarkable endurance and determination.

definitions.meaning: To look at and comprehend the meaning of written or printed matter by mentally interpreting the characters or symbols

examples.sentence: I read books.
He reads the newspaper every morning.
She meticulously reads scientific journals to stay current with research.

definitions.meaning: Feeling or showing pleasure or contentment

examples.sentence: I am happy.
She felt happy about her achievement.
The overwhelmingly positive results made everyone exceptionally happy.

definitions.meaning: At a fast speed; rapidly

examples.sentence: Run quickly!
She finished her homework quickly.
The emergency response team arrived quickly to assess the situation.

definitions.meaning: To perceive the intended meaning of words, a language, or a speaker

examples.sentence: I understand you.
She understands the concept clearly.
To fully understand quantum mechanics requires extensive study and contemplation.

definitions.meaning: Pleasing the senses or mind aesthetically

examples.sentence: The sunset is beautiful.
She wore a beautiful dress to the party.
The breathtakingly beautiful landscape captivated all who beheld it.

definitions.meaning: To have a particular opinion, belief, or idea about someone or something

examples.sentence: I think it's good.
She thinks the movie was excellent.
Philosophers think deeply about the nature of existence and consciousness.

definitions.meaning: An institution for educating children

examples.sentence: I go to school.
The school has many students.
The prestigious school offers comprehensive educational programs.

definitions.meaning: A colorless, transparent, odorless liquid that forms the seas, lakes, rivers, and rain

examples.sentence: I drink water.
Water is essential for life.
The molecular composition of water consists of two hydrogen atoms bonded to one oxygen atom.

definitions.meaning: To mark letters, words, or other symbols on a surface, typically paper, with a pen, pencil, or similar implement

examples.sentence: I write a letter.
She writes stories every day.
The author writes with eloquence and profound insight.

definitions.meaning: A person whom one knows and with whom one has a bond of mutual affection

examples.sentence: She is my friend.
I met my friend at the park.
A true friend provides unwavering support during difficult times.

definitions.meaning: To gain or acquire knowledge of or skill in something by study, experience, or being taught

examples.sentence: I learn new things.
She learns quickly in class.
Students learn most effectively through active engagement with material.

definitions.meaning: To engage in activity for enjoyment and recreation rather than a serious or practical purpose

examples.sentence: I play games.
Children play in the playground.
The orchestra will play a magnificent symphony tonight.

definitions.meaning: The systematic study of the structure and behavior of the physical and natural world through observation and experiment

examples.sentence: I like science.
Science helps us understand the world.
Modern science has revolutionized our understanding of the universe.

definitions.meaning: The abstract science of number, quantity, and space

examples.sentence: I study mathematics.
Mathematics is important in daily life.
Advanced mathematics provides the foundation for theoretical physics.
